blog.description:

check it here on Tumblr or Patreon

question: 40 and 47 thanks!
answer:
Prompt n.40:

“The kids, they ambushed me.”

-°l

Dany looked herself again at the huge mirror beside their bed, adjusting her nightgown and caressing the hinting bump of her belly with affection.

Tired of pacing the room, she wondered how long it would be before Jon’s arrival. They agreed to dine together in their chambers this evening, a rare occasion since they so often had to attend at every imaginable duty during their day as rulers and parents of three. She eyed the bed near her, thinking that she could use some comfort in the meantime. She wouldn’t sleep, but her limbs were surely asking for relief after a full day of surveying some of the newest renovation works in flea bottom.

…

She woke up at a rasping at the door and a muffled swear behind it, then the squeaking of the ancient wood opening. She lifted herself from the bed and peeked out the window, the rich light of dusk just starting to turn into the quiet darkness of the evening. Indigo and lilac shades mixing with orange and red caressed the clouds. At the end she had fallen asleep then, but not for much.

He was now slowly making his way towards their bedroom door, with another low swear and the sound of leather on the floor.

She prepared herself from the view of his beloved husband, but when he came out from the antechamber, she couldn’t stifle a chocked laugh.

There he was, her King all covered in mud and grime, with leaves and straw peeking from his belt and tangling in his hair. He somewhat managed to still have that majestic composure of him. The most majestic mud man indeed!

But since she knew manners, and she was a Queen after all, she managed to stare at him dumbfounded, eyes sparkling with mirth, questioning, with her lips straining to keep her smile at bay.

He wouldn’t provide some explanation, shuffling from one foot to the other, looking at his feet, then everywhere except at her.

Her brows shot up to the crown of her head in an evident question.

He then could do nothing more that exale a deep sigh and sighed: “The kids, they ambushed me.”

She couldn’t keep it all wrapped then, seeing that little pout of him like he couldn’t believe what happened, her snicker started, then boomed in a full hearted laugh, clutching her growing belly to stifle the spasms.

She may just have stopped when she glimpsed the amused and still incredule smile tugging at his lips transforming into a smile of an entirely other nature, that smoldering stare of his growing deeper and darker, his muddy figure approaching her with stalk like moves.

Her smile then faded slowly, and she grew wary “Jon…no…Jon what are you doing?” He watched her innocently, a shrug of his shoulders, but in the meantime he was still coming near the bed. She tried to master her queenly tone “Jon Snow don’t you dare…”

Too late, he jumped on the bed, staining the exact spot where she was moment before with dark splotches, clutching her calves that hadn’t been so fast like the rest of her body to escape his assault. He used them to lure her to him and started to tickle her sides with alarming dedication, her body whriting under his, the mud finally conquering her nightgown too. “Jon noo, you are all dirty!!” But she couldn’t stifle her laughs, so the reprimanding tone was lost and forgotten. “I’m not so sure my Queen, you should check more thoroughly!” At that he hugged her figure tight at her hips and started placing kisses all over her face and bosom. Her own laughs were mingled with his chuckles when her hands started to playfully punch his tangled curls.

Well, to hell all of that, she tugged at his hair and brought him to her lips for a searing kiss. Grime and earth grains mingled with the familiar and arousing taste of him. His body covering hers in that all too alluring way.

Breathing air eagerly in his lungs, he paused to watch her, a playful grin on his luscious lips. “We truly are a mess now my Queen, how we proceed?” “Well that’s unfortunate isn’t it… Luckily I was right to have a hot bath ready then…” He watched her, wordless for a second.

“You-you KNEW!!” His eyes popped out and she couldn’t stop the conspiratory grin. “I am guilty, my King, what will you do about that now?” She managed to answer, just before he resumed his ticklish assault.

✨…………✨…………✨

Prompt n.47 on the making

Well, to hell all of that, she tugged at his hair and brought him to her lips for a searing kiss. Grime and earth grains mingled with the familiar and arousing taste of him. His body covering hers in that all too alluring way.

“You-you KNEW!!” His eyes popped out and she couldn’t stop the conspiratory grin. “I am guilty, my King, what will you do about that now?” She managed to answer, just before he resumed his ticklish assault.

summary: I can’t believe antis think jon saying they’ll come to see you for what you are line is a red herring for dany becoming mad when...
body: I can’t believe antis think jon saying they’ll come to see you for what you are line is a red herring for dany becoming mad when she literally just risked her life, her comrades and also lost a dragon to save Jon (on a mission that they would have had to go on regardless if dany believed him because they still had to convince cersei so don’t even try the “oh but it was HER fault!!” bullshit cause I’m not dealing with it)

blog.name: random-imagines-blog
blog.title: Imagines
blog.description:
Imagines blog run by one person.

Oneshot Requests: Open
Imagine Requests: Open

summary: Imagine Jon Snow being falsely told that you’re dead.
title: Imagine Jon Snow being falsely told that you’re dead.
body:
His initial reaction was to take the sword that he was holding and plunge it deep into the nearest tree with a cry of anguish as if it had been him getting cleaved apart. The others around him stared in wonder of his reaction for Jon was not known for showing such rage unless there was an enemy right in front of him.

After the outburst, Jon disappeared into his room, locking the door behind him and slumped onto his bed. He could picture it clearly. He could see you getting poisoned by the Lannisters, foaming at the mouth, falling to your death onto the floor while everyone was watching, and Cersei - that bitch, drinking her wine as if nothing was happening.

Over the next few days, Jon worked harder than the others. Every spare second was taken up with work, lest his thoughts turn to you. He chopped down trees for wood, he sharpened the blades of everyone in there, he helped Sam organize the small library.

And when the raven came to the wall, he had been the one to unroll it and read the news to everyone. The words didn’t factor in until after he had spoken them, and the dining hall was so silent, one could actually hear the snow outside landing on the ground.

“It was Joffrey.” He said once, and then again. “Joffrey was poisoned, not y/n!”

The misery lifted off of his face as if he had just washed it off. “Y/N’s alive!” He exclaimed, to some half-hearted claps from his friends.

blog.name: gendrie
blog.title: fierce and terrible and hers
blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

summary: Jon could almost see her in that moment, long-faced and gawky, all knobby knees and sharp elbows, with her dirty face and...
body:
Jon could almost see her in that moment, long-faced and gawky, all knobby knees and sharp elbows, with her dirty face and tangled hair. They would wash the one and comb the other, he did not doubt, but he could not imagine Arya in a wedding gown, nor Ramsay Bolton’s bed. No matter how afraid she is, she will not show it. If he tries to lay a hand on her, she’ll fight him.

the “no matter how afraid she is, she will not show it” bit KILLS ME because thats just so arya. it hasnt changed at all since the very beginning. arya cannot stand to show fear or vulnerability. she might be terrified on the inside but she will hide it behind a brave front and jon knows that. he also knows how afraid she would be if they forced her into this situation and how she would fight back. 

Stick them with the pointy end, he’d told her, but if she tried to stick the Bastard, it could mean her life.

Stick them with the pointy end, he’d told her. Wisdom for her wedding night if half of what he heard of Ramsay Snow was true. 

and jon would completely support arya stabbing this man if not for the fact he fears for her safety as a result. but he remembers what he told her when thinking about arya’s imagined fear without even realizing arya still remembers those words too

summary: get to know me meme: [2/8 friendships] jon snow & davos seaworth “he was named lord commander of the night’s watch. he was named...
caption:
get to know me meme: [2/8 friendships]

jon snow & davos seaworth
“he was named lord commander of the night’s watch. he was named king in the north. not because of his birthright, he has no birthright. he’s a damn bastard. all those hard sons of bitches chosen them as their leader because they believe in him.”

summary:
Jon, texting: Answer your phone.

Bran: Okay, give me a minute. I can't find my phone.

Jon: Okay.

Jon, five minutes later:...
body:
Jon, texting: Answer your phone.

Bran: Okay, give me a minute. I can’t find my phone.

Jon: Okay.

Jon, five minutes later: You’re a terrible child. You know you’re killing me. You’re killing your brother.

reblog.comment:
Jon, texting: Answer your phone.

Bran: Okay, give me a minute. I can’t find my phone.

Jon: Okay.

Jon, five minutes later: You’re a terrible child. You know you’re killing me. You’re killing your brother.

Bran: Okay, give me a minute. I can’t find my phone.

Jon: Okay.

Jon, five minutes later: You’re a terrible child. You know you’re killing me. You’re killing your brother.

Bran: Okay, give me a minute. I can’t find my phone.

Jon: Okay.

Jon, five minutes later: You’re a terrible child. You know you’re killing me. You’re killing your brother.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Look no matter how many meta's or falsification of statements & expressions you write about this man. Jon Snow will never stoop...
body:
Look no matter how many meta’s or falsification of statements & expressions you write about this man. Jon Snow will never stoop as low as you wish he would to fulfil your dreams. AND THAT’S JUST THE FACT, NOT AN OPINION. It pains my heart that smh the ruthless nature of this story has turned people so ruthless that they want a perfectly good & sane character like Jon Snow to or suspect he already has betrayed someone. Poor soft soul of Jon Snow couldn’t find it in himself to punish his murderers or punish the Northern traitor’s left over families.

“Allow me to give my lord one last piece of counsel, the same counsel that I once gave my brother when we parted for the last time. He was three-and-thirty when the Great Council chose him to mount the Iron Throne. A man grown with sons of his own, yet in some ways still a boy. Egg had an innocence to him, a sweetness we all loved. Kill the boy within you, I told him the day I took ship for the Wall. It takes a man to rule. An Aegon, not an Egg. Kill the boy and let the man be born. You are half the age that Egg was, and your own burden is a crueler one, I fear. You will have little joy of your command, but I think you have the strength in you to do the things that must be done. Kill the boy, Jon Snow. Winter is almost upon us. Kill the boy and let the man be born.”

Maester Aemon didn’t give this advice to Jon Snow that he last gave to his best friend/brother egg, so one day Jon Snow betrays a woman, specifically his own niece. Just understand that Jon Snow, being a fictional character, has a better moral compass than most people on tumblr.

summary: What tone do you think GRRM is going for with the ending of Jon X in ASoS with the battle? The show has the evil menacing music...
question: What tone do you think GRRM is going for with the ending of Jon X in ASoS with the battle? The show has the evil menacing music going, and in the audiobooks Roy Dotrice delivers the ""It's done", Jon thought" line almost kinda sadly. Is it supposed to be just chaos and a general look at "hey this is a big waste of life isn't it?" given that Stannis, Mance and Jon all have the same enemy in the end?
answer:
It’s a complicated moment for Jon. He’s believed the whole time that the Free Folk would be defeated by superior discipline. He told Ygritte so.

Wildlings fought like heroes or demons, depending on who you talked to, but it came down to the same thing in the end. They fight with reckless courage, every man out for glory. “I don’t doubt that you’re all very brave, but when it comes to battle, discipline beats valor every time. In the end Mance will fail as all the Kings-beyond-the-Wall have failed before him. And when he does, you’ll die. All of you.”

- Jon V, ASoS

He said this in response to Ygritte.

She raised her chin defiantly and gave her thick red hair a shake. “And men can’t own the land no more'n they can own the sea or the sky. You kneelers think you do, but Mance is going t’ show you different.”

- Jon V, ASoS

Ygritte espouses the idealism of the Free Folk, and she represents how it’s not going to survive the winter. She’s the one who cries at hearing ‘The Last of the Giants,’ which is a song about the death of a culture and a people. Ygritte is doomed, and so is what she believes in.

Jon has come to care about the Free Folk, he respects Mance, and here they are being run over by a numerically inferior force bringing their superior organisation and technology to bear. Not only did Jon predict this, but he played a part in making it true, holding the Wall until this force could arrive. He’s watching his own prophecy come true before his eyes. He’s watching the evidence that he was right and Ygritte was wrong. Under the circumstances, Jon can’t take any satisfaction in being right.

summary: Why I think Jon must and will survive to Game of Thrones.
title: Why I think Jon must and will survive to Game of Thrones.
body:
A lot of people seem to think that Daenerys or Jon, even both, might die.  I disagree with Jon’s fate.

All Jon has done since Season 1, he owes it to himself.

It was as a bastard that he was taken under the wing of Lord Mormont, infiltrated with the Free Folk, led the Wall’s battle, earned the respect of Stannis & Davos, was elected Lord Commander, was appointed King in the North, won the respect of Daenerys, became his ally and lover.

Even conceiving a child with Daenerys (what may happen in season 8) could have been done as bastard. They could say that the death of a dragon allowed the birth of a child. No need to: “the blood of two targaryen allow birth” (especially that it is a little propaganda for incest, which does not seem to me to be the main intention of the author).

Jon owes everything he has does to his own merit and not to his name. Without the revelation of his true kinship, I would have told myself that his destiny was to die. I would have thought that he was resuscitated only to win the great war but that he will not be able to live after that.

Except that he’s not only the son of Rhaegar Targaryen, but also his legitimate heir. It makes no sense if Jon dies.This revelation would be useless except for creating a conflict during the last season. But with all that there is to tell, I find it hard to believe that there is such a huge revelation for such a small goal.

On the other hand, I am not sure that Jon will finish on the iron throne. He has never been interested in power and he is a man of the North. If kingdoms divide, he could stay in Winterfell.

Well, we’ll see when the season comes out.
